content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the original and simplified passages

The passage:
The data used for training the system has been captured from the drone, by flying it in and around urban and semi-urban streets, by experts having at least 6-8 years of flying experience.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The passage is complex due to the use of longer phrases and the inclusion of specific details regarding the training process and the experience of the experts. It may be challenging for a university student to easily grasp the information without some simplification. Thus, it does not meet the desired complexity (DC) level of a university student.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage
The section "by experts having at least 6-8 years of flying experience" is complicated due to the specificity and the phrase length.
Simplify this section
Rephrase it as "by experts with 6 to 8 years of flying experience."
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
The data used for training the system has been captured from the drone, by flying it in and around urban and semi-urban streets, by experts with 6 to 8 years of flying experience.
Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original

The information loss in the updated passage is minimal. The original phrase "having at least" was simplified to "with," which slightly reduces the emphasis on the expertise of "at least" but retains the core information regarding the years of experience. 

Severity of information loss: Low. 

This change does not alter the meaning significantly, and the information about the years of experience remains intact. Therefore, it can be considered acceptable under the information loss tolerance (ILT) threshold.
What is the highest severity level identified? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
If needed, adjust the passage to maintain readabily and flow of text
The data used for training the system was captured from the drone by flying it in and around urban and semi-urban streets, conducted by experts with 6 to 8 years of flying experience.
Identify the complexity level of the passage

The complexity level of the adjusted passage is now suitable for a university student. The sentence structure is clearer, and the information is presented in a more straightforward manner, making it easier to understand without sacrificing key details.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Provide the final version of the simplified passage
The data used for training the system was captured from the drone by flying it in and around urban and semi-urban streets, conducted by experts with 6 to 8 years of flying experience.
